page.title: 13SHOPPING IN FORT AUGUSTUS(1)
page.content: As the {Caledonian Canal}is situated almost in the centre of {Fort Augustus most of the shops are to be found on the banks of,or close to the canal. On the north bank of the canal the only shops are a general store,which sells gifts and souvenirs as well as groceries,and a shop which sells tweeds and tartans.On the south bank is the local newsagent,who also sells confectionary and stationery.Close to the newsagent,just past the local pub_{The Lock Inn,}is the butcher's shop,which also sells vegetables.A van from this business supplies outlying districts.Next door to these premises is another general store,part of which is used as a post office.The only other shop on this road is a craft shop which sells leather and sheepskin goods,and souvenirs.
